description: Flags when emotional intensity in media or discourse is disproportionate due to hormonal/chemical amplification (stress hormones, stimulant use).
inputs: Media narrative tone (anger, outrage, fear, elation)
Physiological amplification markers (cortisol spikes, caffeine intake, sleep deprivation)
signals: Persistent volatility without substantive informational content
Chemical-aligned timing (sugar highs, alcohol crashes, stimulant buzz)
outputs: Mitigation suggestions (slow breath, context-switch, hydration, grounding cues)
